alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:22PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fayette County through 845 PM CDT... At 822 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sumner, or 15 miles northwest of Oelwein, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Fayette County, including the following locations... Randalia, Highway 93 And County W 14, Westgate, Highway 93 And County V 68 and Donnan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Iowa.
